metadata.title: CVE-2020-12761 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
modules/loaders/loader_ico.c in imlib2 1.6.0 has an integer overflow (withresultant invalid memory allocations and out-of-bounds reads) via an iconwith many colors in its color map.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libimlib2 - 1.6.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imlib2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2').
